loans.name: Impano Tcb Group

texts.en: Beatrice is 35 years old. She is married with three children. They range in age from a baby of nine days to a child of six years old. She sells various products and has been dealing in a retail business for the past five years. She is a group leader for the group called Impano, which means “a gift”. With the loan, she would like buy more retail business items for resale. The group members sell different items and have different businesses, but they all have the same visions for their businesses, which is to have a better future and to provide food for their families with the profits from the business.

loans.use: To buy more retail business items for sale

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUPAMPA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Paulina; La socia continua con su negocio de compra y venta de ganado, la socia a la vez continua con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir trabajando para su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de arroz, gaseosas entre otros. 
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This lady is a member of the communal bank “Santa Rosita de Ayllupampa,” located in the Urubamba district, Urubamba province, Cusco Department.

Her name is Paulina. She is still buying and selling cattle and at the same time has a grocery store. She has had it for a while and does well thanks to her hard work. She would like to continue working in order to provide for her family.

Paulina requested a loan to buy rice and sodas, among other things. She appreciates the loan she received and promises to pay the installments according to plan.

loans.use: to buy rice and sodas, among other things.

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
José de 41 años, no tuvo la oportunidad de asistir a la escuela,  por sus escasos recursos. Empezó a trabajar desde muy pequeño, se acompaño hace 6 años y tiene 2 hijas. La esposa se dedica al cuido del hogar. Sus hijos viven junto a ellos.

El señor se dedica a la pesca artesanal desde hace 25 años, oficio que aprendió de su padre. Por vivir en la zona costera a pocos metros del mar. Decidió hacer este oficio, pues es su medio de subsistencia. Su trabajo lo realiza en horas de la noche.

El crédito se invertirá para comprar 2 redes, con las cuales mejorara los volúmenes de pesca,  al ser un implemento de suma importancia para su trabajo. Por el momento, trabaja como ayudante de un amigo en su apero de pesca.


Al consultarle sobre sus aspiraciones o sueños, el cliente comento que tiene como meta trabajar duro y poder comprar su propio apero“lancha y motor”. Para con el trabajar y obtener los ingresos suficientes, para los gastos a cubrir en su familia.
texts.en:
Jose, 41, did not have the opportunity to attend school due to scarce resources. He started working at an early age. He has been married for 6 years and has 2 daughters. His wife is dedicated to the care of the home. Their children live with them.
Jose has been engaged in fishing for 25 years, a trade he learned from his father by living in a coastal area a few meters from the sea. He decided to do this job because it is their livelihood. He does his work in the evening hours.
The loan will be invested to buy two nets that will improve fishing volumes. They will be a tool of great importance for his work. For now, he works as an assistant to a friend with his friend's fishing nets. 
When asked about his aspirations and dreams, the client commented that he aims to work hard and be able to buy his own tools, specifically a "boat and engine" for the work to earn enough income to cover expenses in his family.

loans.use: to purchase 2 fishing nets.

loans.name: Avec-Mali

texts.en:
AVEC-Mali is a women’s association based in Mopti, Mali with 74 members. The association engages in a variety of activities, such as selling clean cookstoves, teaching women to read and write and educating women about family planning.  

In July, nine women from the association starting selling solar lamps (seven of them are featured in the photo).  As of the end of September they sold 1,200 lamps and they have ambitious plans to grow the sales. 

Korotoumou (fourth from the left) is one of nine members of AVEC-Mali who sell solar lamps. She is 47 years old and has six children. In addition to her work with the women’s association, Korotoumou is the matron at a health center in Mopti, and she sells grains.  In July, she started selling solar lamps to fisherman, students and farmers, who are reliant on kerosene and flashlights for light.  With a solar lamp, her customers can save money.  Kerosene and mobile phone charging currently cost about $110 per year; whereas, a solar lamp costs $25 and has a lifetime of about five years.  These solar lamps provide 8 hours of light and can charge a mobile phone.

On top of being less expensive, solar lamps are more durable and reliable and keep people from stealing mobile phones. “With a solar lamp, you don’t have to go to a mobile phone charging station and give your phone to someone who may steal your phone or use the call credit you have on your phone,” says Korotoumou.

Selling solar lamps provides income for the women and for the association. The women earn $2 for every lamp they sell and the association earns $3.  The money the association earns is invested in a warehouse to store solar lamp inventory and motorcycles to distribute the products.

The solar saleswomen are well organized – each responsible for her own sales territory. They educate their communities about the benefits of solar lights and generate lamp sales through group meetings and demonstrations at night.

Since customers cannot afford to pay for the lamps up front, the women need working capital. A Kiva loan will allow the solar saleswomen to obtain solar lamp inventory from NOTS Lampe Solaire on credit.  When they receive payment from their customers they will re-pay the Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy solar lamps that they will sell in their communities

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Living in a thatched roof house in a rural village of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Ann is aged 33 years old and married. She and her husband have three children, all of whom are still in school. She and her husband earn a living through cassava growing and they have been in this business for overt than 10 years. With her current business, she is able to earn approximately 19,000KHR per day to support her family. 
This is the third loan for Ann with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is requesting a loan with VisionFund of 2,500,000KHR to buy fertilizers, pesticides and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more crop yields and sell it for a good price so as to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and rice seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Jossias Nguiliche

texts.pt:
Jossias de 45 anos de idade, casado pai de 5 (filhos) dos quais 4 (quatros) estao a frequentar a escola no ensino primario e secundario  a outra è menor de idade para frequentar a escola. Ele è negociante de productos da primeira necessidade a mais de 10 anos.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar produtos da primeira necessidade tais como: amendoim, arroz, feijao, caldo, rebucados e diversos prudutos para aumentar o volume do seu negocio no seu proprio estabelicimento comercial, actividade que esta ser acompanhado junto com a sua mulher
texts.en:
Jossias is 45 years old and married. He has five children, four of whom attend primary and secondary school and the other daughter is too young to go to school. He has been selling products that are household staples for over 10 years.
The current loan will be used to purchase products that are household staples such as peanuts, rice, beans, broths, candy and assorted goods so he can increase turnover in his store, a business he runs alongside his wife.

loans.use: to purchase products that are household staples such as peanuts, rice, beans, broths, candy and assorted goods so he can increase turnover in his business.

loans.name: Joana Francisco

texts.pt:
Joana de 57 anos de idade, casa e mae de 4 (quatro) todos estao a frequentar a escola no ensino primario e secundario. Ela è agricultora e negociante informal de productos de machamba, actualmente trabalha numa machamba  junto com seu esposo tendo culturas de repolho e tomate nas proximedade de regadios de boane.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar material de construcao ( cimento, chapas de zinco, barrotes e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para dar continuidade a construcao da sua casa.
texts.en:
Joana is 57 years old and married. She has four children, all of whom attend primary and secondary school. She's a farmer and an unofficial trader of farm supplies. She currently works on a farm alongside her husband and owns cabbage and tomato crops located close to irrigated areas in Boane.
The current loan will be used to purchase construction supplies (cement, metal sheets and beams) and to pay for labor so she can continue building her house.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (cement, metal sheets and beams) and to pay for labor so she can continue building her house.

loans.name: Quiteria Albino

texts.pt:
Quiteria de 35 anos de idade, casada e mae de 4 (quatro) filhos todos estao a frequentar a escola no ensino primario e secundario. Ele è operario agricola numa empresa de producao de banana.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar material de construcao ( chapas de zinco, cimento, blocos, barrotes, pedra e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para dar continuidade com a construcao da sua casa.
texts.en:
Quiteria is 35 years old and married. She has four children, all of whom attend primary and secondary school. She's a farm worker for a banana company.
The current loan will be used to purchase construction supplies (metal sheets, cement, bricks, beams and rocks) and to pay for labor so she can continue building her house.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (metal sheets, cement, bricks, beams and rocks) and to pay for labor so she can continue building her house.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Unidas está en su 2do ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 1 de ellas tiene que seguir trabajando para mejorar, ya que esta con ingresos muy bajos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Antonia, quien realiza venta de comidas en lo que gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo está mejorando bastante, ella es una persona muy trabajadora que lucha por salir adelante e ir dando a su familia lo que necesitan.
Pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para seguir haciendo sus comidas, como ser verduras, condimentos, harina, huevo, carne y demás. Ella agradece por la oportunidad que ella y sus amigas están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Unidas [United Women] Group is in its second cycle in the Poverty Stoplight Program, where everyone is working to eliminate poverty.  One of its members must continue working in order to improve; her current income is quite low.

Antonia sells food that she makes.  Thanks to her work and determination, she is improving.  She is very hardworking and she fights to move herself forward so taht she can give her family everything they need.

She is asking for this loan to buy the ingredients she needs to continue making her food products, like vegetables, condiments, flour, eggs, meat, and other items.  She is thankful for the opportunity that she and her friends receive.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, condiments, flour, eggs, meat, and other items.

loans.name: Kai

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Kai.  She is married and has two children, aged 5 and 3 years old. In 2000, Kai established her clothing business. She began her business because she wanted to assist her husband in the running of the home. Working 7 days a week and 16 hours  a day, she earns about Le 800,000 every month from this business. 

Kai would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Kai requires a loan in order to buy more cotton and lace clothing for resale. In the future, Kai plans to build a house to live in and to educate her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more cotton and  lace clothing for resale.

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Mr Koffi vit avec sa femme coiffeuse et leurs 02 enfants à Lomé. Ils sont âgés de 12 et 07ans et sont scolarisés. Koffi est revendeur. Il exerce son activité de vente d’amplis, de radio et de télévision sur étalage. Avec ce second crédit qu’il sollicite dans notre institution, il désire acheter des radios, des télévisions et des ampli. Avec les profits, il souhaiterait acheter un terrain, devenir grossiste et assurer l’éducation des enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. Koffi lives with his wife, a hairstylist, and their two children in Lomé. The children are 12 and 7 years old, and both go to school. 

Koffi is a retailer who sells amplifiers, radios, and televisions from a stall. He plans to use this 2nd loan he is seeking to buy radios, televisions, and amplifiers. 

He would like to use the profits to buy some land, become a wholesaler, and ensure his children's education.

loans.use: to buy televisions, radios, and other items for resale.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Meet Rachel, a resident of Kericho. She loves farming and has been farming for 24 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs and tea. Her greatest challenge in farming is getting a ready market and transporting her farm produce.

Rachel said that Juhudi Kilimo has helped her to expand her farm and it also has very good loan officers. During the Juhudi micro finance training session, Rachel said that she learnt that MFIs offer low interest rates.

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how this loan would benefit her family, Rachel replied, it will help them sell more eggs and thus give them a better lifestyle.

Rachel owns the following: cows, poultry, but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Rebecca. She is married and has four children aged 17, 14, 12 and eight. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her for schooling. 

In 2010, Rebecca established her stationary business. She began her business just to enhance her independence. Her business location is strategic. It is located at the Eastern Polytechnic and her main customers are mostly students. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 500,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Rebecca requires a loan in order to buy dozens of text books costing SLL 3,000,000. She hopes that this loan will will increase her stock level. In the future, Rebecca plans to build a house and to educate her children. 

She appreciates the gesture she is receiving from Kiva. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy stationary material for her shop.

loans.name: Lilian's Group

texts.en: Lilian, Wycliffe, Esther are young residents of the Kawangware slum in Nairobi. Due to the lack of jobs available, they have experienced unstable employment that pays low wages and long periods of unemployment.  They all aspire to becoming business owners and are currently selling energy-efficient products like solar lamps and fuel-efficient cook stoves around other slums in Nairobi.  They work very well together as a team.  The group will use the loan to buy more stock, as well as an agent toolkit that will help them to sell to their communities. They look forward to earning a decent wage to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase stock to sell

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David lives in the Litein area of Kenya. He has 2 children, and has been doing this work for 3 years. His primary income sources are milk and eggs.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Dairy cow.' His biggest challenge is: 'Lack of enough financial resources to expand business.' Animals on the farm have been given no names.

David was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'Low interest rates.' This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'They help us with finance for development.'

His highest monthly expenses are farming costs. When asked: 'How will this loan benefit his family', David replied: 'Improve livelihoods.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. David owns the following: 'cow and poultry,' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, or automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, solar power, and running water', but does not have 'electricity, sewing machine, TV, or DVD'.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Jerevasio

texts.en: Jerevasio is 48 years old, has 9 children, a farmer, and works 12 hours a day. He began the business because the environment favors it. He will use the money to buy fertilizers and seedlings. He hopes to have a big banana plantation, however, his challenge is the dry weather that dries down his bananas. He is honest and hard working.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Boucotte Sindian Group

texts.fr: Ce banc villageois de Boucotte Sindian est inauguré le 29 mars 2002 suite à la bonne entente dans le quartier.Madame Dieynaba à droite de la photo la main levée est la représentante du groupe.Mariée et sans enfant, elle s’active dans ce commerce de vente de légumes depuis plusieurs années au marché et à domicile.Ce crédit lui permet de développer d'avantage son activité et les bénéfices à la prise en charge des frais de nourriture de la famille.
texts.en:
This banc villageois, Boucotte Sindian, was created on March 29, 2002 after harmony came to the area. 

Madame Dieynaba, with her hand raised at the right of the photo, is the group representative. She is married and has no children. She has been selling vegetables for a number of years at the market and out of her home. 

This loan will help her further develop her business, and the and the profits will allow her to take care of expenses for food and for her family.

loans.use: buy vegetables.

loans.name: Steven

texts.en: Steven is 35 years old. He is a poultry farmer and his other source of income is maize farming. He began the business because he was aware of it and he got interested in it. He will use the loan to buy chicks. His clients are traders from the city. He hopes to start such a business for his elder son. His challenge is fluctuating prices for feed. He is hard working.

loans.use: to buy chicks

loans.name: Monhbold

texts.en:
Mr.Monhbold is 25 years old and lives with his wife and a son in small house in Suhbaatar province, Mongolia. His wife Enhbayar is 25 and currently stays home taking care of their 2 year old son. 
Monhbold has been providing an inter-city public transportation service business between Ulaanbaatar and Suhbaatar province center since 2010. He is a well-experienced, careful driver. He is well-known among the residents for his reliable and comfortable service. He is now requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to replace the heating system of his house in order to avoid burning lot of coal or firewood during winter and to stay warm and comfortable with his family. He is a hardworking and enthusiastic man.

loans.use: to replace the heating system of his house in order to avoid burning lot of coal or firewood during winter and to stay warm and comfortable with his family

loans.name: M.itiaz

texts.en:
M.Imtiaz is a 52-year-old married man who is an honest and hardworking citizen of Pakistan. He lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with his family. His wife is a very hardworking and responsible housewife. 

Since 1983, Imtiaz has been in the milk-selling business, which is the only source of income for his family. Currently he is interested in purchasing a buffalo to grow his business but finds it difficult due to financial constraints. Imtiaz has requested a loan of 150,000 PKR from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. This will not only help him grow his milk-selling business but will increase his net income and savings as well. He hopes to provide a quality education for his children. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a single lady of 56 years. She has three children. Lilian operates a retail shop in Nagarariga in the outskirts of Limuru. She has been in business for thirteen years and gets a monthly income of 17,300 shillings.

This is Lillian’s fourth loan with KADET LTD; she plans to use the entire amount to buy cereals like rice, beans, maize etc for her business. In the future she would like to expand her business to become a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy cereals like rice, beans, peas etc

loans.name: Regalo De Dios Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Regalo de Dios está conformado por 10 integrantes, ocho mujeres y dos hombres, padres de familia con hijos bajo su responsabilidad, originarios del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país, y se caracteriza por ser una zona productora de leche. Estos integrantes son personas responsables, trabajadoras, que han tenido que luchar duro para salir adelante en la vida. Y brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
 Gracias a su espíritu y su tenacidad, Guadalupe  es la coordinador del banco comunal y tiene por actividad económica la elaboración y venta de tortillas comida típica de la región, la cual la vende en su casa y de forma ambulante, la rutina de trabajo de Guadalupe es trabajar unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto de forma ambulante, con un pana en su cabeza de unos 20 kg. Actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto ya que es su forma de vida y la de su familia. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y comprar materia prima para la elaboración de las tortillas como maíz, leña, gas, bolsas, cal. El banco comunal Regalo de Dios agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Regalo de Dios Communal Bank is made up of ten members, eight women and two men who are heads of household with children in their care.  They're from El Sauce, located in the northern part of the country and known for being a milk-producing region.  These members are responsible and hardworking people who have had to strive hard to get ahead in life and give their children a better future.

Thanks to her spirit and tenacity, Guadalupe's the coordinator of the communal bank.  Her job is making and selling tortillas, a traditional food in the region.  She sells them at home and on foot.  Guadalupe's work routine is to work some ten hours a day selling her product on foot carrying a basket that weighs 20 kilos on her head.  She does this with great pleasure because it's her way of life and her family's.

Guadalupe's going to invest the loan in working capital and buy ingredients to make tortillas such as corn, firewood, gas, bags, and lime.

Regalo de Dios Communal Bank is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders give to low-income people and poor countries like Nicaragua so they have the means to decent jobs.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make tortillas

loans.name: Damaris De La Cruz

texts.es:
La joven Damaris de la Cruz, es comerciante de venta de ropa desde hace 2 años en unos de los Mercados más concurridos de la ciudad de Chinandega, inicia sus labores a las 8:00 am llegando a su puesto de trabajo a las 8:30 am preparando y arreglando sus productos que ofertará de forma ambulante a su clientela finalizándola a las 12:00 pm, negocio con  el cual logra brindar el sustento diario a sus 2 hijos ya que es madre soltera, la joven viaja a Managua 2 veces por semana a realizar compras de mercadería al por mayor permitiendo obtenerlas a un precio más favorable. 

La joven Damaris solicito el crédito a Ceprodel  el cual fue  utilizado para la compra de productos como pantalones, camisetas, camisas, blusas, licras, ropa interior para ambos sexos, que servirá para mejorar los ingresos y su inventario con productos nuevos dándoles un mejor bienestar a sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
Damaris de la Cruz has been a clothing merchant for two years in one of Chinandega’s busiest markets.  She starts her work day at 8am arriving at her sales stand at 8:30 to arrange the goods that she’ll sell to her customers until noon.  She’s able to support her two children with this business since she’s a single mother.  She travels to Managua twice a week to buy merchandise at wholesale thus getting them at a better price.

Damaris asked Ceprodel for a loan that she used to buy products like pants, t-shirts, shirts, blouses, Lycra, underwear for both genders that will help her increase income and inventory with new products to provide better well-being for her children.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Bienvenidos A Pilcopata Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Bienvenidos a Pilcopata” en el centro poblado de Pilcopata en el distrito Kosñipata en la provincia de Paucartambo en el departamento del Cusco. 

Rene Mateo tiene 34 años de edad es casado y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene una hermosa familia, él y su familia viven en la hermosa ciudad de Pilcopata.  

Rene Mateo es un joven trabajador que desde muy niño aprendió de sus padres la agricultura y la venta y compra de madera,  él es una persona carismática y amable que sale adelante con el apoyo de su pareja, él en sus horas libres se a otras actividades entonces él en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar madera de la selva de Pilcopata para luego venderlo en la ciudad del Cusco.   
 
Este banco comunal está conformado por varias personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Los socios se dedican a la agricultura, a la gansería, al engorde de ganado, a la venta y compra de madera. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.(Las personas que aparecen en la inferior de la fotografia llegaron tarde a la reunion).
texts.en:
A group of neighbors and friends formed the Communal Bank “Bienvenidos a Pilcopata” (Welcome to Pilcopata) which is located in the central village of Pilcopata in the District of Kosñipata, Paucartambo Province, Department of Cusco.

Rene Mateo is 34 years old, married, and has a beautiful relationship with his lovely family.  He and his family live in the gorgeous city of Pilcopata.  Rene Mateo is a hardworking young man who learned as a boy how to farm from his parents.  He also buys and sells wood.  Rene Mateo is a charismatic and friendly individual who is able to move forward with the support of his partner.  During his free time, he engages in other activities.  He is taking this opportunity to request a loan to buy wood from the jungle of Pilcopata that he can eventually sell in the city of Cusco.  

This Communal Bank consists of several people who look at each moment as an opportunity to get ahead.  Through their efforts, they are able to provide a better future for their children.  The members engage in farming, raising geese, fattening cattle, and buying and selling wood.  

The members are grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promise to complete their payments according to the established terms.  (The individuals who appear in the smaller photo arrived late to the meeting.)

loans.use: to buy wood to sell.

loans.name: Artemia

texts.en: Artemia is running a general store for a living. She is 56, widow and having four children that lives with their own family near Artemia's residence.Aside from this, she also was engaged in hog fattening selling pigs in town to earn a living. She borrowed a loan to buy new items like grocery goods, rice and feeds for sale. She is hopeful that with this loan, she can sustained the store and be able to have a stable source of income for their future.

loans.use: to buy new items like grocery goods, rice and feeds for sale

loans.name: Jerlyn

texts.en:
Jerlyn is from Don Jose Aguirre, Manukan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 30 years old and is married with two children.

In 2012, Jerlyn applied for her membership with PAGLAUM MPC. Hearing all the benefits, she never hesitated to become a member. She maintains the status of being a member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Recently, Jerlyn has applied for financial assistance of PHP 14,900.00 for additional capital for her business. Through this, she hopes to increase the income of her fish vending. She has found assistance for her financial needs through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Lev

texts.en: Test description. Test description. Test description. Test description. Test description. Test description. Test description. Test description. Test description.

loans.use: to sell clothing

loans.name: Frida

texts.en:
We had an opportunity to meet 37-year-old Fridah Kaari, a farmer who hails from Nkubu.  She has two children and has been actively involved in farming for five years.  She has a farm where she grows tea and other crops and also rears cows and poultry, which also serve as a source of income.  She says that she enjoys the output produced and that the biggest challenge she faces is exploitation from middlemen who bridge the gaps with customers.

This loan will enable her to purchase water pipes that will ensure an easy flow of water to the farm, creating a continuous flow of water to her crops and animals.  This will allow her to bring in more income and thus improve her family’s living standards.

Fridah said that she chose Juhudi Kilimo because it is the best institution that finances low income earners.

loans.use: to purchase water pipes.

loans.name: Palomitas De Juana Azurduy Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PALOMITAS DE JUANA AZURDUY” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Nancy es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: costura de chamarras, costura de polleras, tienda de carnicería, café videos, tejido de macramé.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Nancy es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio taller de costura de chamarras; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de sus familiares a quienes ayudaba en su negocio desde niña, cuando tuvo su primer hijo decide emprender un negocio independiente
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas del departamento de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el préstamo sin muchos requisitos.
texts.en:
The group "Palomitas de Juana Azurduy” will start its first loan cycle with the nonprofit Pro Mujer, as part of the village bank Centro Focal de los Andes. The group consists of eight members and is led by a board of directors, with Nancy as the President. The businesses of the members of the communal bank are varied and include sewing blankets, sewing traditional skirts, a butcher’s shop, a video café and macramé fabric.

The loan they are taking out will help small-scale businesswomen including Nancy. She says it is the first time that she has used Pro Mujer, and that she joined the group through the invitation of one of the institution’s promoters on a visit to her home. Currently she has a blanket-sewing business. She says that she learnt about this trade from family members since she was a young girl, when she helped them with the business. After the birth of her first child, she decided to set up on her own.
 
The loan she is now taking out is to increase her capital to buy fabric through wholesalers in the department of La Paz. Afterwards she will sell the products at her stall. This form of work allows her to generate income to support her family, as she is single and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes a loan without a lot of conditions.

loans.use: to buy fabric through wholesalers to make blankets

loans.name: Chhay

texts.en: Chhay is 48 years old and married. Her family consists of her husband and five children, one of whom just graduated from high school this year. Chhay and her husband manage a rice farming business on their own land in Kampong Cham province. Farming is the sole source of their income. Chhay wanted to support her daughter in her education at the university in Phnom Penh, but her family’s resources are very limited and she can’t afford to send her daughter to school. For this reason she would like to borrow a loan of 1,600 US dollars to cover the four-year program costs of her daughter. Her daughter, Sokunthea, plans to enter the Faculty of Accounting and Finance at Western University in Phnom Penh. Chhay has complete confidence in her daughter that she is committed to her course, and believes that education is one of the key factors to alleviate the poverty. Chhay and her daughter appreciate the help of people all around the world who have contributed their funds to programs like Kiva via its partners, HKL, which will allow students from low-income families to continue their educations.

loans.use: to cover the four-year program costs of her daughter.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en: Margarita and her mother Martha are Peruvian artisans who specialize in handcrafted holiday ornaments that celebrate Peruvian folk arts. The women would like to stock up on raw materials so they can increase production. Margarita and her mother have been selling through NOVICA since 2003. This is Margarita's story: "Since 2002, we have been crafting holiday ornaments. We use traditional materials in innovative ways, combining ribbons and fabrics with miniature people, beads and tiny straw baskets. Everything we make uses Peruvian materials that few people take advantage of. We think they are just wonderful. We wanted to make something pretty, and I wanted to be able to stay at home with my baby, Lorenzo. We are very grateful to all of you who participate in this campaign of solidarity with Peruvian artisans. With this microcredit, we'll be able to buy materials for our traditional Christmas ornaments. Thank you very much." Use the link below to view Margarita's handcrafted ornaments on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/4053

loans.use: to stock up on raw materials so they can increase production

loans.name: Leslie

texts.en:
Leslie is a Peruvian artisan who specializes in handmade sterling silver jewelry. She would like to invest in the purchase of silver, her main material, to increase production.

Leslie has been selling through NOVICA since 2008. This is her story:

"I have always been interested in art. It was a natural choice to study design. After that, I studied jewelry design, which I've practiced since 2003. Making jewelry offers me a sanctuary away from the world where I can do what I want. I love art and three-dimensional pieces, and I love to be able to touch what I create in my mind. To me, my craft is like a magical experience that allows me to express what I feel through silver and gems."

"Thank you all for appreciating Peruvian arts and taking part of this microcredit. I plan to purchase the materials I need with it, in order to increase my production, in time for the holiday season."

Use the link below to view Leslie's silver jewelry on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/6660

loans.use: to purchase silver, her main material, to increase production, in time for the holiday season.

loans.name: Butooro Twekulakulanye Group

texts.en:
Jane a married woman of five children is a member of Butooro Twekulakulanye group. She basically does farming, which she began with the intention of raising tuition for her children. She also rears pigs to get additional income. 

She  wants the loan to buy more pigs. Her clients are community members. She hopes to build a big piggery project to supply most of the pork eating areas in the city. Her challenge is limited capital, which  she hopes to overcome if she keeps getting loans from Ugafode. She is hardworking and determined.

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Joab

texts.en:
Meet Joab, a farmer who lives in Kitale in Nortrift Kenya. This is an area where farmers have invested in a lot of farming activities. Joab is involved in dairy and crop farming, where his major source of income is the sale of milk and crops. He has been involved in farming for 5 years. In farming, Joab is experiencing challenges of diseases and lack of animal feed, but he enjoys taking care of his livestock for better production.

Joab chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they are committed to helping farmers in improving their lives. Joab says this loan will help him introduce poultry farming on his farm and thus get eggs for sale. This will increase his income base.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence, a single mother of three children, resides in one of the city's suburbs. She earns her income from the small rooms that she lets out at affordable prices to low income earners. Florence educates her children and supports her needy relatives with the income from the rentals. She used the previous loan to construct an underground water tank to make the rooms more habitable for her tenants, and now wants to renovate the rental units so as she can increase the amount she charges every month to expand her income base.

Like with the previous loan, her dream has always been to establish a real estate of rentals. Florence still believes that as long as she is still alive, her dream will become a reality.

loans.use: to buy materials to renvate her rental units

loans.name: Stephen's Group

texts.en: Nicholas Stephen, Mercy, Nicholas and Eunice reside in an informal settlement in Nairobi called Kawangware. They have spent much of their youth moving between low-paying jobs and long periods of unemployment. They are all passionate about becoming business owners and currently sell environmentally-friendly products such as solar lamps and fuel-efficient cookstoves to their communities and other slums in Nairobi. Their biggest challenge is not having enough capital to purchase more stock to sell. The group will use the loan to buy more inventory so that they can earn a decent wage and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase clean energy technologies to sell

loans.name: Casido

texts.en:
Casido is married with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Casido is 46 years old and one of her children is in school.

Casido has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines. Casido requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of bananas to sell.

Casido has been in this business for four years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Dukundamatungo Cooperative

texts.en:
Patrick is the  leader of a cooperative called Dukundamatungo in Kinyarwanda which is loosely translated in English as "Let's Love livestock". Patrick has been chairing the cooperative for the past 12 years, and they have various members who have the same vision of upgrading their business of selling milk from the traditional ways to modern ways of business, and have the vision of transforming the lives of their cooperative members and the community at large. 

Patrick has expressed the challenge of their business of lacking a truck to transporting milk from farmers to the the collection center where they gather many liters which they transport to the milk industry in the city. He has requested the loan to buy a truck for help in transporting milk from the collection center to the milk industry. With the profits from the business of milk selling, they will reinvest in their business such as buying coolers, and restock their animal pharmacy.

video.title: Kiva Borrower Dukundamatungo Cooperative from Rwanda

loans.use: To buy a truck to transport milk from the milk collection center to the milk industry

loans.name: Dasse's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis décembre 2009.Il est composé de membres qui habitent le même village,elles ont comme activité le petit commerce et l'agriculture.

Celle qui se trouve à gauche de la photo et levant le bras,est la responsable du groupe,elle est âgée de 53 ans ,est mariée et mére de 02 filles.

Son activité est le commerce de mil,maïs et de l'arachide.Elle pratique ce type d'activité depuis sa jeunesse ce qui fait au fil des années ,elle a pu acquérir de l'expérience et se tisser une relation solide avec ses clients.

Avec ce financement,elle compte acheter du maïs pour une valeur de 100000f,du mil pour une valeur de 50000f et de l'arachide pour une valeur de 50000f.

Son objectif est d'augmenter son épargne et assurer la scolarité de ses 02 filles.
texts.en: This group was created in December 2009. It is made up of members who live in the same village. Their businesses are small stores and agriculture. The one who is at the left of the photo raising her hand is the leader of the group. She is 53 years old, married and the mother of two daughters. Her business is the sale of millet, corn and peanuts. She has run this type of business since her youth, and over the years she has been able to acquire experience and forge a solid relation with her clients. With this financing, she expects to buy corn at a value of 100,000 f, millet at a value of 50,000 f, and peanuts at a value of 50,000 f. Her objective is to increase her savings and ensure the education of her two daughters.

loans.use: to purchase corn, millet and peanuts.

loans.name: Las Magníficas De Franz Tamayo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS MAGNÍFICAS DE FRANZ TAMAYO” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Ricardina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: confección de polleras, confección de deportivos, venta de polleras, venta de chompas, venta de ropa, venta de material de construcción, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Ricardina es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de producción de mantas de vicuña y de alpaca; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió cuando trabajaba de operaria en un taller, hace cinco años decide emprender su propio espacio de trabajo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de hilo de alpaca y vicuña) que adquirirá de las ferias tradicionales de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a solicitud del cliente. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta ahorro que se tiene en la institución.

loans.use: Compra de hilo de alpaca y vicuña

loans.name: Nueva Asunción Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVA ASUNCIÓN”  iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Hilaria es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, tienda de barrio, venta de llaveros, tejido de chompas, tejido de mantas, venta de abarrotes.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Hilaria es integrante, ella indica que hace es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una tía que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de llaveros; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió recientemente con un poco de capital, ayudando a su tía.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de llaveros) que adquirirá de empresas mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro que se realiza en la institución.

loans.use: Compra de llaveros

loans.name: Las Retamitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS RETAMAS” iniciará el octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por diez  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Máxima es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de ferretería, venta de zapatillas y ropa, venta de edredones, venta de gorras de alpaca, taller de costura, elaboración de resorteras, confección de mantas, reparación de calzados.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Máxima es integrante, ella indica que hace ocho ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de detergentes; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años, al ayudar a su madre en la comercialización del mismo negocio, pasado el tiempo decide emprender un espacio independiente de negocio donde actualmente vende.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de detergentes) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de crédito, salud y capacitación que le ofrece la institución.

loans.use: Compra de detergentes

loans.name: Cruz De Lagunas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CRUZ DE LAGUNAS” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por diez  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Abigail es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de ropa, servicio de albañil, taller de carpintería, comerciante de muebles, producción de colchones, venta de papa, chuño y tunta.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Abigail es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de licores; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de sus padres hace varios años, cuando tuvo a su hijo decide emprender su espacio de venta independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de licores) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de crédito, salud y capacitación que le ofrece la institución.

loans.use: Compra de licores

loans.name: Puya Raymundi Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PUYA RAYMUNDI” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Domitila es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de papa, venta de fundas, venta de coca, venta de saleros, venta de tapetes, venta de chompas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Domitila es integrante, ella indica que hace dos ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de papa; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años, al presentarse la necesidad de generar economía decide emprender la venta de este producto que se comercializa ampliamente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de papa por mayor) que adquirirá de las ferias mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de crédito, salud y capacitación que le ofrece la institución.

loans.use: Compra de papa por mayor

loans.name: Luna Radiante Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LUNA RADIANTE” iniciará el octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Evelin es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: costura de deportivos, confección de prendas de vestir, venta de lencería, venta de electrodomésticos, venta de productos YABAL, venta de cosméticos, venta de empanadas, confección de prendas de militares.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Evelin es integrante, ella indica que hace siete años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su suegra que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de lencería; da a conocer que este negocio emprendió con un pequeño capital, el que posteriormente amplio y en la actualidad por las fiestas de fin de año desea ampliar.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lencería) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de crédito, salud y capacitación que le ofrece la institución.

loans.use: Compra de lencería

loans.name: Jardin De Rosas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “JARDIN DE ROSAS” iniciará el décimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Elsa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: librería, ferretería, tienda de barrio, costura de deportivos, venta de detergentes, venta de víveres, artículos de limpieza.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Elsa es integrante, ella indica que hace diez años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su tía que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta artículos de limpieza; da a conocer que este negocio emprendió hace varios años, ya que conocía la mercadería porque desde niña ayudo a su madre en la venta de este producto.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de artículos de limpieza) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará de forma ambulante en las ferias de la Ciudad de La Paz. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “Jardin de Rosas" communal bank will start its 10th loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana regional office. It is made up of eight members and directed by a board, of which Elsa is the chair. The businesses that members of the communal bank carry on are varied, and include a bookstore, hardware store, neighborhood store, sewing sportswear, sale of detergents, sale of groceries and sale of cleaning items. 

The loan they will take out benefits small business owners such as Elsa. She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for 10 years, and joined at the invitation of her aunt, who is a member of the institution. Currently she has a business selling cleaning items.  She says that she started this business several years ago. She was familiar with the merchandise, because from a young age she helped her mother sell this product. 

The loan she will now take out is to increase working capital (purchase of cleaning items) which she will acquire in the wholesale stores in the city of El Alto, and later sell as a street vendor in the markets in the city of La Paz. This type of work allows her to generate income for supporting her family, as she is married and has a son. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health clinic that the institution offers.

loans.use: To buy cleaning items to sell

loans.name: Amar Azul Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMAR AZUL” iniciará el décimo tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Julia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: confección de polleras, venta de comida, venta de cosméticos, venta de baterías, elaboración de cotillones, venta de abarrotes, salón de belleza.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Julia es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años, cuando ayudaba a su madre en el negocio familiar, posteriormente decide emprender su propio negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de papa, arroz y aceite por mayor) que adquirirá de las ferias mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “Amar Azul" communal bank will start its 3rd loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes regional office. It is made up of nine members, and led  by a board of directors, of which Julia is the chair. The businesses that members of the communal bank carry on are varied; they include sewing skirts, selling food, sale of cosmetics, sale of batteries, making party favors, sale of groceries, and beauty salon.

The loan they will take out benefits small business owners such as Julia. She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for five loan cycles, and joined at the invitation of a friend, who is a member of the institution. Currently she has a business selling food. She says that she started this business several years ago, when she was helping her mother in the family business and later decided to start her own.

The loan she will now take out is to increase working capital (buy potatoes, rice and cooking oil at wholesale) which she will acquire in the wholesale markets in the city of El Alto, and after preparing them, sell at her stand. This type of work allows her to generate income for supporting her family, as she as she is in a common-law relationship and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health clinic that the institution offers.

loans.use: To buy potatoes, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Khana Naira Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KHANA NAIRA” iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Dora es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: servicios de filmación, venta de jugos, venta de electrodomésticos, confección de chamarras, venta de frescos, venta de juguetes, tejidos de manta de vicuña.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Dora es integrante, ella indica que hace siete ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de servicios de filmación; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años de una amiga, en la actualidad es su fuente de generación de ingresos económicos
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para la renovación del equipo (compra de equipo de filmación) que adquirirá de las tiendas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo utilizará en los espacio de trabajo que tenga. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud, crédito y capacitación que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “Khana Naira" communal bank will start its 7th loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes regional office. It is made up of eight members, and led by a board of directors, of which Dora is the chair. The businesses that members of the communal bank carry on are varied; they include film-making services, sale of juices, sale of small appliances, making jackets, sale of fruit juices, sale of toys, and weaving vicuña shawls. 

The loan they will take out benefits small business owners such as Dora. She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for seven loan cycles, and joined at the invitation of a friend, who is a member of the institution. Currently she has a film-making business. She says that she learned this business several years ago from a friend, and that currently it is her source of income.

The loan she will now take out is to update her equipment (buy film-making equipment), which she will acquire in the stores in the city of El Alto and later use in the workspace she has. This type of work allows her to generate income for supporting her family, as she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health clinic, loan program, and the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: To buy film-making equipment

loans.name: Hormiguitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “HORMIGUITAS” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Olga es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: comercio de chicharron (plato tradicional de Bolivia), venta de pescado, costura de chamarras, venta de productos medicinales, venta de condimentos, venta de cosméticos, taller de costura, tejido de chompas, costura de ropa deportiva.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Olga es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio aprendió de un trabajo anterior, donde le enseñaron la técnica de tejido posteriormente emprendió su propio espacio de trabajo con un poco capital que tenía y con el préstamo de Pro Mujer.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente  a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido del público. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y capacitación que le ofrece la institución.

En la fotografía no aparese una de las señoras, ya que esta de costado y no se la puede ver
texts.en:
The “Hormiguitas" communal bank will start its 4th loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Panamericana regional office. It is made up of nine members, and led by a board of directors, of which Olga is the chair. The businesses that members of the communal bank carry on are varied, and include: sale of chicharron (traditional Bolivian dish), sale of fish, sewing jackets, sale of medicinal products, sale of condiments, sale of cosmetics, sewing workshop, weaving sweaters and sewing sportswear. 

The loan they will take out benefits small business owners such as Olga. She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for three years, and joined at the invitation of a friend, who is a member of the institution. Currently she has a business weaving shawls. She says that she learned this business in a previous job, where she was taught the technique of weaving, and later started her own workshop with a bit of capital she had and with a loan from from Pro Mujer.

The loan she will now take out is to increase her working capital (purchase of wool) which she will acquire in the wholesale stores in the city of El Alto. After making the shawls, she will sell them to customers. This type of work allows her to generate income for supporting her family, as she lives with her partner and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health clinic, and the training that the institution offers.

One of the women does not appear in the photo, as she is off to the side and can't be seen.

loans.use: To buy wool.

loans.name: Estrellas Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESTRELLAS II” iniciará el décimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lidia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, tejido de busos, taller de cerrajería, venta de dulces, tejido de dulces, panadería, tejido de chalinas, chapistas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lidia es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de ferretería; da a conocer que este negocio lo adquirió recientemente de un conocido que le vendió el negocio armado.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tornillos, fierros y palas) que adquirirá de las distribuidoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las reuniones de pago con su grupo.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Estrellas II” (Stars II) is starting its tenth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Community Center.  This group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors in which Sra. Lidia serves as its president.  The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses such as selling food, knitting sweatshirts, managing a metalwork shop, selling sweets, knitting baby clothes, managing a bakery, knitting scarves, and operating an auto body shop.  

This loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Sra. Lidia.  She says that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago after receiving an invitation from a promoter from the organization who visited her at her house.  Lidia currently has a hardware store.  She gained knowledge about this business after acquiring it recently from an acquaintance who sold it to her fully stocked.  

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying screws, braces, and shovels.  She acquires her inventory from the wholesale distributors in the city of El Alto and then sells these products from her retail space.  Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her family.  Lidia is married and has four children.
 
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Lida said that she enjoys the payment meetings with her group.

loans.use: to buy screws, braces, and shovels.

loans.name: Flor Naciente Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR NACIENTE” iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Daniela es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de chicharro (comida boliviana tradicional), venta de pollo, taller de tapicería, venta de fruta, costura de pantalones, venta de CD’s.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Daniela es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de CD’s; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su tía a quien ayudaba en su negocio, posteriormente decide emprender un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de CD’s) que adquirirá de las distribuidoras vendedoras de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Flor Naciente" (Blooming Flower) is in its seventh loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Communal Bank.  This group consists of nine members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Daniela as its president.  The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses such as selling food, selling "chicharro" (a traditional Bolivian food), selling chicken, selling upholstery, selling fruit, sewing trousers, and selling CDs.  

This loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Sra. Daniela.  She says that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago after receiving an invitation from a promoter from the organization who visited her at her house.  Daniela currently has a business of selling CDs.  She is knowledgeable about this line of work because she learned by helping her aunt with her business.  Eventually she decided to establish her own independent business.  

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying CDs.  She acquires her products from the distributors in the city of El Alto and then sells them from her retail space.  Working in this manner enables her to generate income to sustain her family.  Daniela is in a common-law relationship and has one child.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Daniela said that she enjoys the training seminars about health and credit.

loans.use: to buy CDs to sell.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Pedro Vicente Maldonado es un Cantón que se encuentra al Noroccidente de Pichincha -  Ecuador; que día con día va creciendo, en este Cantón existe mucho comercio, aquí vive y trabaja Luis es un hombre de 43 años, tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 2 son de una anterior relación, en la actualidad mantiene una sólida relación en unión libre con la Señora Leydi ella tiene 22 años no trabaja se encarga de una pequeña tienda que tienen en  casa y del cuidado de los 3 hijos que tienen juntos.
Don Luis tiene un taller de mecánica automotriz al cual le dedica gran parte de su tiempo aprendió de este negocio desde muy niño junto a sus hermanos mayores ya que ellos se dedican a esta actividad él trabaja un promedio de 10 horas diarias por lo que no tiene mucho tiempo libre, le gusta mucho hacer deporte y cuando le queda algo de tiempo después del trabajo hace deporte y también les dedica tiempo a su familia.
En esta actividad de mecánica para él no se le hace muy complicada ya que la viene haciendo muchos años y sabe mucho sobre la misma, lo que más se le dificulta es cuando tienen que cambiar los paquetes de un carro grande ya que es peligroso se puede soltar la gata y recibir un fuerte golpe del mismo
Don Luis tiene muchos sueños que quisiera realizar como comprarse un terreno y hacer su casa propia para ahí poner su taller mecánico, este préstamo que está solicitando a Kiva le ayudará a Don Luis a mejorar sus ingresos económicos ya que lo invertirá en el pequeño negocio que es la tienda a la cual quieren surtir de víveres y productos de primera necesidad para sus clientes, agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por la gran ayuda que le darán a él y toda su familia, lo que les permitirá tener un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Pedro Vicente Maldonado is a Canton located in the northwesten part of  Pichincha, Ecuador.  It grows a bit each day.  In this Canton there is a lot of commerce.  Luis lives and works here.  He is 43 years old and has 5 children, 2 of whom are from a prior relationship. He is currently in a solid relationship with his common-law wife with Leydi.  She is 22 years old and does not work.  She has a small store in their house, and she cares for the 3 children they have together. 

Luis has an auto repair shop where he spends a great deal of his time.  He learned how to do this work very young along with his older brothers, as they were mechanics.  He works around 10 hours per day, so he does not have much free time.  He really enjoys working out and when he has a bit of time after work, he exercises and spends time with his family.  His work as a mechanic is not very hard for him because he has been doing it for many years and knows a lot about it.  What is most difficult for him is when he has to change the tires on a large car.  It is dangerous because the jack can slip and the car could slam into him. 

Luis has many dreams he would like to realize like buying land and building his own home where he could put his auto repair shop.  This loan that he is requesting from Kiva will have Luis improve his income.  He will invest it in the small store he has which stocks basic necessities for their customers.  He is thankful to Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for the great help they provide to him and his family, which will allow them to have a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase basic food items to stock his store.

loans.name: Taurinas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “TAURINAS” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Susana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de mantas, ayudante de limpieza, venta de refrescos, venta de menudencias de pollo, ventas de plásticos, servicio de chofer.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Susana es integrante, ella indica que hace un ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de carnicería; da a conocer que este negocio aprendió de un trabajo anterior, donde apoyada en esta actividad, posteriormente decide emprender su propio espacio de negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de carne por mayor) que adquirirá de las distribuidoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente  lo comercializará a pedido del público. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el el apoyo del asesor de crédito.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Taurinas” is starting its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Community Center.  This group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors in which Sra. Susana is the president.  The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses such as weaving blankets, working as a cleaning assistant, selling soft drinks, selling chicken giblets, selling plastic goods, and providing chauffeur services.  

This loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Sra. Susana.  She says that she joined Pro Mujer one loan cycle ago after receiving an invitation from a friend who is also a member of the organization.  Susana currently has a butcher shop.  She is knowledgeable about this line of work because she learned the trade from her previous job where she was a butcher’s assistant.  Later on, she decided to establish a space for her own business.  

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying meat in bulk.  She acquires her inventory from the wholesale distributors in the city of El Alto and then sells her goods to the public upon request.  Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her family.  Susana is single and has four children.  
 
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Susana said that she enjoys the support of her credit advisor.

loans.use: to buy meat in bulk.

loans.name: Kellen

texts.en: Kellen is 50 years old and married to Johnson. They have four children living in a rural area – Rukungiri District. She is applying for a loan of UGX 1,000,000 with the purpose of improving her banana plantation through mulching to generate more yield. Her agricultural business has helped her to pay tuition for her children of whom two are at the university. Her dream has been to increase her banana production, now standing at 200 bunches per month, to 500 with the help of a financial boost from Kiva lenders through UGAFODE. In the photograph are Kellen, her husband and the Ugafode credit officer (right to left).

loans.use: To buy mulch

loans.name: Cariñositas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CARIÑOSITAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Dionicia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de carne, venta de coca, venta de salteñas, venta de comida, tejido de chompas, venta de CD’s, servicio de construcción, venta de tucumanas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Dionicia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de coca; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su cuñada, quien desarrolla el mismo comercio, con el pasar del tiempo ella decide implementar su propio espacio de comercio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de coca) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente  lo comercializará a en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de crédito y ahorros.

loans.use: Compra de coca

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary Wamalwa is 45 years old, married and blessed with six children age 24, 21, 17, 15, 11, and 8. She is a business woman and she has been in business for three years. Right now her monthly income is KES 3,000. 

She is borrowing a loan of KES 30,000 to boost her business, and she will use the anticipated profit from the business to stock more goods for her business. This is her second loan. She paid her previous loan successfully. Her hope is to have a good life and a successful future.

loans.use: To boost her business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 43 years old, married, and they have been blessed with children between 25 and 7 years old.

She is a dairy farmer and she has been in business for 15 years. Right now her monthly income is KES 10,000. 

She is borrowing a loan of KES 30,000 in order to boost her business. She will pay back the loan with the anticipated profit from the business.

This is her second loan and she successfully paid her previous loan.

loans.use: To boost her dairy farming.

loans.name: Jose Marcelino

texts.es:
José  nació en la ciudad en la parroquia Toacazo de la provincia de Latacunga, perteneciente a la República del Ecuador, esta zona se caracteriza por sus habitantes que se dedican a la crianza y venta de animales menores y ganado de leche y de carne,  tiene 48 años de edad, actualmente se encuentra casado, tiene por el momento 1 hijo a su cargo, viven en casa propia.
