Florence’s major challenge is lack of enough capital to purchase more utensils and chairs for use in her restaurant. With the loan, however, the challenge will soon be history. Florence's neighbors commented that she is hardworking and dedicated.

loans.use: To buy restaurant items such as utensils and chairs.

loans.name: Grap Go Fenam Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the "Grap Go Fenam" group, meaning: "Get up go find it." They are small-scale businesswomen based in Waterloo, a fast-growing town in western Sierra Leone, near Freetown, Sierra Leone's capital city. Together, they are requesting a loan of 2,500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for the entire group from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, increase their profits and consequently improve their standard of living.

The featured leader of this group is Fatmata. Fatmata is thirty-four years old; she was born in Lunsar town, northern Sierra Leone, but she is currently residing in Waterloo, together with her husband and three children. Her husband is a businessman and her children attend primary and secondary schools. Fatmata sells clothes. With her share of this loan (500,000 SLL), she is going to buy a large quantity and a wide variety of clothes to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity and a wide variety of clothes to add to her current stock

loans.name: Aramayis

texts.en:
Aramayis is from the Argavand village of the Armavir region. He has been involved in agriculture for many years.

Near the village where Aramayis lives with his family, he owns land where different types of vegetables are cultivated (tomato, onion, greens, etc.). Aramayis also keeps livestock which includes a pig and 12 chickens.

Aramayis's family helps him with running a farm. His wife takes care of livestock and his 20-years-old son assists his father to gather the harvest and sell it. Aramayis now asks for this loan to be able to increase the farm that he owns. With the help of this loan of USD 3000, Aramayis will be able to purchase 2 oxen, forage for feeding animals and fertilizer. This is very important for his further farming activities and he hopes for Kiva lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for 2 oxen, forage for feeding animals and fertilizer.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is married with eight children. Lorna is 47 years old and lives in San Miguel, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

She owns mango trees and sells mangos to earn a living. She has had this business for 27 years. Each month, she earns 10,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 25,000 for additional capital.

Lorna has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Lorna hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: for fertilizer and mango financing

location.town: Liloy-San Miguel, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 56 years old and has one child in school.

Elizabeth has a buy-and-sell fruits business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fruits like oranges, mangoes, apples, etc. to sell.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fruits like oranges, mangoes, apples, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Even though Aba grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, she is an entrepreneur. She prepares and sells banku for a living. Banku is a traditional Ghanaian dish made using fermented corn and cassava dough that is mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water into a smooth white paste. Banku is usually served with okro stew, groundnut soup, palm nut soup, or pepper sauce. 

Aba primarily sells her banku at Ayensudo located in Elmina. Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began 11 years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her raise her three children. 

Aba has identified that there is a growing demand among consumers for her banku. She is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory. Thus, she aims to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of maize and cassava to help her to prepare more of her tasty banku.

With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba wants to ensure that all of her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of maize and cassava to help her to prepare more of her tasty banku

loans.name: Fusena

texts.en: Although Fusena has received no prior formal education, she is a petty trader at Ayensudu in Elmina. She specializes in selling watermelon. She has been involved in this enterprise for some years now. Fusena is married and has three children. Her husband is a vulcanizer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. She will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of watermelon for supply, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Fusena plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to increase amounts of watermelon for supply, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a baker in Ayensudu near Elmina. She did not have any form of formal education. She bakes bread. She supplies them to retailers both near and far, as well as individuals around her locality. She has been involved in this business for quite some time. Mary is a single mother with three children. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her children in paying their school fees and other general expenses. She has noticed that there are growing demands among consumers for her bread. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited funding. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase more flour, sugar, and a modern oven for the bakery. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to education to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more flour, sugar, and a modern oven for her bakery.

loans.name: Asibe

texts.en: Asibe has no form of formal education. She sells cooked rice which is served with boiled eggs, vegetables, fish,and meat stew. She sells to individuals around her locality of Ayensudu in Elmina. She has been involved in this business for some years now. Asibe is a single parent with three children. The income from her business normally goes towards helping her pay her children’s school fees. She has noticed that there are growing demands among consumers for her food. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited working capital. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase more rice, vegetables, fish, meat, and other ingredients for the preparation of the food. With the new profits from her expanded business, Asibe wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to education.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, vegetables, fish, meat, and other ingredients for food preparation.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Although Ekua has received no prior formal education, she is a fruit vendor at Ayensudu in Elmina. She specializes in selling watermelon. She has been involved in this enterprise for some years. Ekua is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. She will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of watermelon for supply, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of watermelon for supply, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Ameeda

texts.en: Although Ameeda has received no prior formal education, she is a petty trader. She specializes in selling saucepans in Elmina. She has been involved in this enterprise for some years. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a blacksmith. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Aweeda will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of saucepans, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of saucepans, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Gladys Ama

texts.en:
Gladys operates a chop bar, a local Ghanaian restaurant, in her village. She has had no formal education. She prepares and sells fufu which is made of cooked cassava and plantain which is pounded into smooth round balls. Fufu is served with groundnut soup, palm nut soup, or light soup, and fish or meat. She sells to individuals around Elmina. She has been involved in this business for many years. 

Gladys is married and has three children. The income from her business normally goes toward helping her husband pay their children’s school fees and utility bills. 

She has noticed that there is a growing demand among consumers for her food. She is unable to meet their needs due to limited working capital. Thus, she aims to use her loan to purchase more cassava, plantains, palm nuts, groundnut paste, and other ingredients for the preparation of her food for sale. 

With the new profits from her expanded business, Gladys wants to ensure that all her children will be given the opportunity for an education to further distance their family from poverty. Gladys is photographed here preparing her food.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava, plantains, palm nuts, groundnut paste, and other ingredients for the preparation of her food for sale.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba specializes in selling gari, a traditional Ghanaian snack that is made from starchy powdered cassava. She has been involved in this business for a long time. 

Araba is a junior high school graduate. She is married to a security officer, and they have three children. The proceeds from her business normally go toward helping to support herself and her extended family. 

Araba wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory by buying more gari for sale. 

She plans to reinvest future profits into her business to help her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands, to help her children receive the best education, and to pay her utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more gari for sale.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Although Florence has received some formal education as a middle school-leaver, she is a petty trader in Elmina. She specializes in selling bags of rice and sachet water. She has been involved in this enterprise for many years. 

Florence is divorced and has five children. The proceeds from her business normally go toward helping her cover the family’s general expenses and pay for the children’s school fees. 

She will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of sachet water and rice for sale to aid her in improving her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Florence plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of sachet water and rice for sale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a provisions seller, located in Elmina. She has had some formal education, as she is a middle-school-leaver. She is married and has three children. Her husband is teacher. She has been selling provisions for some years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees.

She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of eggs, soft drinks, groceries, biscuits, Milo, milk, sweets, and other groceries. This will enable her to meet rising customer demand. Mary hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to develop her business further, and to ensure that all her children receive quality education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of groceries to sell at her store, including eggs, biscuits, milk and others

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a middle school-leaver. She sells food items like onions, canned fish, canned tomatoes, pepper, salt, eggs, and rice. She sells to individuals around Elmina. She has been involved in this business for many years. 

Josephine is married with five children. The income from her business normally goes toward helping her husband, a teacher, to pay her children’s school fees. 

She has noticed that there is a growing demand among consumers for her food items. She is unable to meet their needs due to limited working capital. She aims to use her loan to purchase onions, canned fish, canned tomatoes, pepper, salt, eggs, and rice for sale. 

With the new profits from her expanded business, Josephine wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all of her children will be given the opportunity for an education and to put up a container shop to display her items.

loans.use: to purchase onions, canned fish, canned tomatoes, pepper, salt, eggs, and rice for sale.

loans.name: Georgina O.

texts.en:
Georgina O. is married to a businessman and they have four children. She is a Form Four Leaver. Georgina O. operates a chop bar (where Ghanaian local dishes are sold). Georgina O. is the one pounding the fufu (fufu is made of cooked cassava and plantains pounded into smooth, round balls), served with groundnut soup, palm nut soup, light soup, and fish/meat. She sells to individuals around her locality in Elmina. She has been actively involved in this business for many years. 

As the sole breadwinner of the family, she uses her income to provide for the entire family. Georgina O. will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of cassava, plantains, fish, meat, etc., thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to further diversify the type of food that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of cassava, plantains, fish, meat, etc., thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame did not have any form of formal education but this has not stopped her from achieving a better life. She is a fish monger. She sells smoked fish and salted fish at Elmina. She buys fresh fish from the fishermen at the seashore and then smokes and salts for them for sale. She has been involved in this business for years. Maame is a single mother with five children. The income from her business is used in helping her cater and to pay her children’s school fees. She has noticed that there are growing demands among consumers for her fish. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited working capital. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase more fish for sale to increase her inventory levels. With the new profits from her expanded business, Maame wants to ensure that all her children will be given the opportunity to education.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for sale to increase her inventory levels.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth did not have any form of formal education but this has not stopped her from achieving her aim of receiving a better life. She is a fishmonger. She sells smoked fish at Elmina. She buys fresh fish from the market and smokes it for sale to individuals in her locality and also supplies to others for resale. She has been involved in this business for many years. Elizabeth is married with four children. The income from her business normally goes towards helping her husband (who is a fisherman) to pay her children’s school fees. She has noticed that there are growing demands among consumers for her fish. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited working capital. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase more fish for sale to increase her inventory levels. With the new profits from her expanded business, Elizabeth wants to ensure that all her children will be given the opportunity to education since she did not have that opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for sale to increase her inventory levels.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is a primary school leaver. She sells smoked fish to individuals around her locality in Elmina. She has been involved in this business for some years. Esi is married with four children. The income from her business normally goes towards helping her husband (who is in salt processing) to pay her children’s school fees. She has noticed that there are growing demands among consumers for her fish. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited working capital. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase more fish to aid the growth of her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to education.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to aid the growth of her business.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes specializes in selling corn and cassava dough. She has been involved in this business for a long time now. She has no form of formal education. She is a single parent with three children. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping support herself and her extended family. Agnes wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory by making more dough for sale, thus increasing the quantity of maize and cassava in the near future. In the long term, Agnes plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands, ensure that her two children acquire the best of education, and pay her utility bills.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory by making more dough for sale, thus increasing the quantity of maize and cassava in the near future.

loans.name: Edvar

texts.es: Edvar está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo el podrá comprar enseres para su vivienda como ollas platos, cubiertos, cocina, entre otros, ya que debido a las lluvias ha perdido sus pertenencias y de esta manera podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, así el podrá seguir esforzándose en su empleo como locutor de radio y seguira luchando para poder hacer realidad sus gran sueño:2” construir su vivienda de material noble”.
texts.en: Edvar is very grateful to Kiva lenders; thanks to their support, he will be able to buy household goods such as pots, plates, cutlery, and a stove, among other items, since he has lost his belongings due to the rain. In this manner, he will be able to improve his family's quality of life. In this way, he will be able to continue to work hard as a radio announcer and strive to achieve his ambitious dream: to build his home out of quality materials.

loans.use: to buy household goods.

loans.name: Jesus Manuel

texts.es:
Jesus es un joven de 20 años, trabaja en el pequeño negocio de su padre, ya que el lo apoya con visitar a sus cliente ya que ofrecen el servicio de seguridad, actualmente se encuentra estudiando derecho en la universidad, principalmente estudia en las noches ya que por la mañana trabaja.

Jesus agradece el apoyo de los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda el podrá inscribirse en un diplomado de derecho y de esta manera poder adquirir un mejor conocimiento y podrá seguir estudiando y luchando para realizar su gran sueño:” Tener su propio estudio de abogados”.
texts.en: Jesus is a young man of 20 years. He works for his father's small business where he helps in customer service and offering security services. He is currently studying law at the university. He mainly studies at night since he works in the mornings. Jesus is thankful for the support of Kiva lenders. Thanks to their help, he will be able to enroll in an law certificate program. That way, he can gain more knowledge, continue studying and fighting to realize his overall dream: "to have his own law practice."

loans.use: to enroll in a certificate program

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick lives in the Nanyuki area, central province, in Kenya. He is 37 years old, and he is married and blessed with two children. He is a businessman and he does farming. He has been in the business for more than six years now, and the business has grown; now he has one employee. 

He knew about Milango through friends, and now he seeks a loan to buy wheat, potato and french beans seedlings for the farm business. He also owns a public-transport business that operates and earns him extra income. The challenge in business is a lack of capital to fund his operations. The extra income that he will raise will improve his standards of living. He hopes that in the next five years, his business will grow.

loans.use: to buy wheat, potato and french beans seedlings

loans.name: Laieng's Group

texts.en:
Laieng, aged 55, is living in a rural village of the Tbaung Khum district, and has six children. To make a living, she has been farming rice and growing watermelon. The current business earns her about 70,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day to support the family.

Laieng has just begun with VisionFund this loan cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy a water-pumping machine for supporting her paddy business. She hopes to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy a water-pumping machine for supporting her paddy business

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Vinh's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Banteay Meanchey province’s Moungkul Borey district, Vinh, 53, has four children in total. 

Vinh has been farming rice, while her husband is a fisherman. Having been in this business for 20 years, she is able to earn about 40,000KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Vinh is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan.  As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland, and use a portion of it to spend on buying household supplies. 

She hopes to make more income to improve her family’s living standard.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkol Borey District

loans.name: Sokheng's Group

texts.en:
Sokheng is a local borrower from Kompong Cham province. She is 39 years old and a mother of two children. To support her family, she has been farming cassava as the main source of income and working as a paid worker during her spare time to earn additional income. Her cassava business earns her 20,800 KHR per day. 

In her group of three, she and one co-borrower are second-cycle borrowers. The remaining borrower is a fourth-time client with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan which she repaid with success has enabled her to support her cassava farming by timely paying a weeding fee and permitting her to provide decent meals for her children. Now, she is a leader of her group consisting of three. They are requesting a loan amount of 3,600,000 KHR, of which 1,200,000 KHR is her loan portion. She will spend her loan portion to pay a plowing fee and a weeding fee and to buy insecticide for her crop. She hopes that she can earn more income than before.

loans.use: to pay a plowing fee and a weeding fee and to buy insecticide for her crop.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a middle school-leaver. She is a single mother and has five children.

Currently, she sells food items like groundnut paste, canned tomatoes, powdered pepper, and oil in Elmina. She has been in this business for several years. 

The profits from her business normally go towards paying the family's utility bills and her children's school fees. Her loan will be used to purchase an increased amount of groundnut paste, canned tomatoes, and oil for resale.  

Joyce hopes to use the new profits from her business to set up her own shop and increase her working capital. In the future, she wants to expand her business into neighboring villages and to give her children a better standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase groundnut paste, canned tomatoes, and oil for resale.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
After graduating from middle school, Comfort decided to set up her own provision and fabrics shop in Elmina located in the Central Region. The profits from her business normally go towards helping her husband pay their children’s school fees. 

Comfort wants to increase her inventory due to a growing number of customers. Unfortunately, she does not have enough working capital. As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase an increased amount of Milo, margarine, oil, fabrics, and shoes to meet the demand of her customers. 

Comfort aims at using the profits from her business to support her husband, a carpenter, with the upkeep of their house while ensuring that their five children are able to receive a better education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of Milo, margarine, oil, fabrics, and shoes to meet the demand of her customers.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Even though Cecilia grew up in difficult circumstances, she is now a successful petty trader. She is married to a fisherman and has five children. 

She operates a provision shop at Elmina located in the Central Region. She sells provisions like Cowbell milk, toothbrushes, margarine, tissue rolls, and sugar. Cecilia has been in this business for several years. She uses all of her income to support her husband and to feed and provide for the entire family. 

Cecilia’s loan will be used to purchase an increased amount of Cowbell milk, coffee, toothbrushes, margarine, tissue rolls, and sugar for sale. She hopes to use the new profits to grow her current business and to increase her capital base. 

In the future, Cecilia wants to expand her business into neighboring villages and give her children a better education.

loans.use: to purchase Cowbell milk, coffee, toothbrushes, margarine, tissue rolls, and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
After graduating from junior high school, Hannah decided to set up her own small business in Elmina near Cape Coast. She is married to a mason and has five children.

She is a successful petty trader who sells items like toothbrushes, toothpaste, and soaps. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband pay their children’s school fees. 

Hannah wants to increase her inventory due to a growing number of customers. Unfortunately, she does not have enough working capital. As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase an increased amount of toothbrushes, toothpaste, and soaps to sustain her business. Hannah aims to use her profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase toothbrushes, toothpaste, and soaps to sell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
As a woman who attended school up to middle school, Rebecca sells items like soaps, washing detergents, Dettol (a specific brand of soap) in Elmina, near Cape Coast. She is married to a waiter and has no children. 

Rebecca has been in her business for years now. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband pay for the family's utility bills.

Rebecca's loan will be used to purchase an increased amount of her soaps to sell.  

Rebecca hopes to use the new profits from her business to set up her own shop and to increase her capital base. In the long run, she wants to expand her business into neighboring villages. Rebecca plans on having children in future, so she is saving towards future school fees and living expenses.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of her soaps, Dettol, washing detergents, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Maame Ekua

texts.en: After graduating from junior high school, Ekua decided to set up her own small business at Abura, which is located near Cape Coast. She sells slippers and shoes and has been in this business for five years. She is married to a mason and has one child. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband pay their child’s school fees. Ekua wants to increase her inventory due to the growing number of customers. Unfortunately, she does not have enough working capital. As a result, this loan will be used to purchase more slippers and shoes that meet her customers' demands. Ekua aims at using her profit to expand her business and set up her own shop.

loans.use: to purchase slippers and shoes

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
After graduating from junior high school, Afia decided to set up her own business in Abura, located in Cape Coast. She sells children's, men's, and women's clothing. She is also a food-vendor. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband pay their children’s school fees. 

Afia wants to increase her inventory, due to a growing number of customers. Unfortunately, she does not have enough working capital. As a result, this loan will help her to purchase more women's and children's wear to sell, as well as ingredients to use in preparing her local dishes. 

Afia aims to use the profits from her business to support her three children in receiving a better education.

loans.use: to purchase more women's and children's wear to sell, as well as ingredients to use in preparing her local dishes.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina received some education until the end of middle school. Currently she sells provisions like milk, sugar, tin tomatoes, milo, etc. at Abura located near Cape Coast. Paulina is married to a farmer and has two children. She has been in this business for two years. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband pay the family's utility bills and their children's school fees. Her loan will be used to purchase an increased amount of sugar, milk, tin tomatoes, milo, etc. for sale. Paulina hopes to use the new profits from her business to support her children’s education and to give them a better standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of sugar, milk, tin tomatoes, milo, etc. for sale.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua is a successful second-hand clothing seller in Abura, near Cape Coast. She has been educated through the end of senior high school. She is married to a petty trader and has two children. 

Ekua has been in her business for five years. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband pay their children's school fees. 

Her loan will be used to increase her current stock levels. Ekua hopes to use the new profits from her business to grow her second-hand clothing business and to increase her capital base, as well as to improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: to increase her current stock levels of second-hand clothing to sell.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
As a woman who went as far as junior high school, Abena sells fabrics, body creams, and jewelry in Abura, near Cape Coast. She is married to a petty trader and has three children. 

Abena has been working in her business for six years. The proceeds from her business normally goes toward helping her husband pay for the family's utility bills and their children's school fees. 

Abena's loan will be used to purchase an increased amount of fabrics, body creams, and jewelry to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to set up her own shop and to increase her capital base.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of fabrics, body creams, and jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Guadalupe De Jesus

texts.es: Guadalupe de 28 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 5 años y 11 años de edad. Guadalupe tiene una tienda la cual con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado adecuar en su lugar de residencia. Con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un cuarto para dar mayor comodidad a sus hijos por lo que desea comprar ladrillo, cemento, arena y hierro. Expresa que con lo que percibe en su negocio de tienda y con la ayuda de su esposo logrará  pagar las cuotas que el crédito implica.
texts.en: 28-year-old Guadalupe lives in her own house with her husband and their two children, ages 5 and 11. Guadalupe owns a store which she has managed to adapt, with much effort, to her place of residence. In order to improve their living conditions, she is requesting this FUSAI loan to invest in the construction of a room to make her children comfortable. It is for this reason that she wishes to buy brick, cement, sand, and iron. She expresses that with the money she receives from her store and with the help of her husband, she will be able to pay the fees associated with the loan.

loans.use: to buy brick, cement, sand, and iron to build a bedroom.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba is a baker in her village. She did not have any form of formal education. 

Aba bakes bread. She bakes her bread in a locally-made oven which is made of red clay, molded round with an open space in front of it. She supplies the bread to retailers, both near and far, as well as individuals around her locality,  Ayensudu, located in Elmina. She has been involved in this business for quite some time. 

Aba is divorced with four children. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her children in paying their children’s school fees and other general expenses. 

She has noticed that there are growing demands for her bread among consumers. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited funding. 

Thus, Aba aims to use her loan to purchase a modern oven, flour, sugar, and other ingredients for the bakery. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba wants to ensure that all her children are given the opportunity of education, to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase a modern oven, flour, sugar, and other ingredients for the bakery.

loans.name: Mercedes Antonio

texts.es: Mercedes de 36 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos de 14 años y 11 años de edad. Mercedes es un hombre trabajador quien hace todo lo que este a su alcance para dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado construir su vivienda la cual le hace falta colocar puertas y algunas ventanas. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de puertas metálicas y ventanas. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así poder dar mayor seguridad a su familia.
texts.en: Mercedes is 36 years old and lives in a home of his own with his wife and two children, ages 14 and 11.  Mercedes is a hardworking man who does everything within his reach to provide better living conditions for his family.  With great effort he has managed to build a house but it still needs doors and some windows, so he is asking for a loan through FUSAI to buy metal doors and windows.  He expects to be able to obtain this loan so he can improve his family’s safety.

loans.use: to buy doors and windows.

loans.name: Jose Humberto

texts.es: don jose desde hace varios años se dedica a la crianza de ganado bovino y adicional a eso tambien se dedica a la venta de cocos por las diferente colonias, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra sacar adelante a su familia, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, Don jose esta solicitando un credito para la compra de una novilla para poder seguir con la crianza de ganados  ya que esa es su fuente de trabajo y asi poder obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Don Jose has been making a living raising cattle and other animals for several years.  He also sells coconuts in the different nearby towns.  With these jobs he is able to earn enough to move his family forward.  He lives in his own house with his wife and their four children.  

Don Jose is requesting a loan to purchase a heifer so that he can continue raising livestock.  This work is his main source of income and so in doing this, he will be able to earn more revenue and give his family an improved quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a heifer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy drinks, fruit juice, fizzy drinks, water and so on in bulk.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is married and has three children. His wife is a petty trader. He has had some form of formal education, as he is a middle school graduate. Isaac currently sells provisions and operates motor transport services in Ve-Wudome (near Hohoe) and its surrounding villages. 

Isaac has been working as a product seller for close to ten years. His income is used to help his wife pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. 

He plans on using his loan to purchase an increased quantity of soap, canned drinks, candies, candles, and engine oil for the monthly servicing of his motorbike, thus allowing him to meet rising customers’ demand. 

He hopes to use the profits from his enterprise to develop his business further and ensure that all his children receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of soap, canned drinks, candies, candles, and engine oil for the monthly servicing of his motorbike.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is married with three children. She has received some schooling until the end of junior high school. Esther currently fries and sells special fried yams and sweet potatoes in Ve-Wudome (near Hohoe). She called it special because it is coming from a special lady. 

She has been involved in this industry for about three years now and other petty trading business for ten years now. Her husband is into farming. Esther’s income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses. 

Esther will use the loan to purchase and increase her existing yams and sweet potatoes, and introduce ripe plantains capacity. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Esther plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to purchase and increase her existing yams and sweet potatoes, and introduce ripe plantains capacity.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: After graduating from vocational school where she learned how to sew, Patience decided to set up her own sewing center in Ve-Wudome (near Hohoe). With over 15 years of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help her to purchase more cloth for resale to her customer, zippers, thread and buttons. She aims at using the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a peasant farmer) with the upkeep of their house and ensure that their child is able to experience a better life. She also wants to save enough to build a fashion designer center to employ teenage girls and mothers.

loans.use: to purchase more cloth, zippers, thread and buttons

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is married to a farmer. She has four children. She uses her income to help her husband pay the household expenses and to save for a rainy day. As a primary grade 6 graduate, Elizabeth currently sells porridge in Ve-Wudome (near Hohoe). With over 14 years of experience in this trade, Elizabeth sees an opportunity to expand her enterprise further. Nevertheless, she does not have the working capital necessary to increase her quantity of stock. Thus, her loan will be used to buy bags of maize, millet, bread, doughnuts, groundnuts and sugar, indirectly helping her to boost her overall sales. Elizabeth wants to make her business self-sustainable as soon as possible. As a result, she plans to channel the new profits from her expanded business back into her porridge business

loans.use: to buy maize, millet, bread, doughnuts, groundnuts and sugar

loans.name: Celestine

texts.en: Celestine is married with three children. She has received some schooling through the end of middle school. Currently, Celestine owns a provision store in Ve-Wudome (near Hohoe). She has been involved in this industry and other petty trading businesses for the past 29 years now. Her husband is a petty trader (businessman). Celestine’s income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses. Celestine will use the loan to increase her existing soap, tinned tomatoes, tinned fish, sachet water, biscuits and milk powder capacity. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Celestine plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory to sell

loans.name: Korsi

texts.en: After graduating from senior high school and learning how to work on motorbikes, Korsi decided to set up his own auto mechanic shop business in Ve-Wudome (near Hohoe). With over 12 years of experience, he is currently looking to expand his enterprise further. Unfortunately, he is limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help him to purchase more motor parts, working tools and a water-pumping machine for washing motorcycles and cars. He aims at using the profits from his business to help support his wife (who is a petty trader) with the upkeep of their house while ensuring that their two children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more motor parts, tools and a water-pumping machine

loans.name: Afua

texts.en: Afua is a petty trader who is involved in the sale of dried peppers, onions and other foodstuffs in Ve-Wudome (near Hohoe). She has had some form of formal education through middle school form one but couldn’t graduate due to financial difficulties. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a peasant farmer and she sometimes sells his produce from the farm for him. Afua has been working as a petty trader for close to 20 years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans to use her loan to purchase an increased quantity of peppers and various vegetable like okra, garden eggs, and onions, allowing her to meet the rising customer demands. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of buying a market stand, so she can stop hawking and sell from a fixed location instead.

loans.use: to purchase more peppers, okra, garden eggs, and onions to sell

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith specializes in frying and selling fish. She personally goes to the river bank to buy her fish and fries it over there and later brings it home for sale in Ve-Wudome (near Hohoe). She has been educated through the end of middle school.  She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is in to farming. Judith has been working in this enterprise for 10 years now. She is responsible for supporting her husband in paying the family's utility bills and their children's school fees. Her loan will be used to increase her current stock (gallon of oil, baskets full of various types of fish) levels. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to grow her fried fish business and increase her capital base. In the long run she wants to expand her business into neighboring villages and sell wholesale to other women especially food vendors.

loans.use: to increase her current stock (gallon of oil, baskets full of various types of fish) levels.

loans.name: Etornam

texts.en: Etornam is a small-scale engine oil seller and a petty trader in Ve-Wudome (near Hohoe). She has had some formal education as she is a senior high school graduate. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is an auto mechanic. Etornam has been working as a petty trader for close to 4 years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. Etornam as a very determined young woman. She saw the need to introduce the sale of engine oil to her husband’s auto mechanic shop when she realized that her husband and her customers buy from a shop nearby. Her husband had never sold it but ends up selling on credit, and he later stopped. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of engine oil, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demand. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to develop her business further and ensure that all of her children receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase additional engine oil, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demand.

loans.name: Fredinard

texts.en: Fredinard is married to a petty trader. He has 7 children. He uses his income to help his wife pay the household expenses as well as save for a rainy day. As a middle high school graduate, Fredinard currently sells provisions in Ve-Wudome (near Hohoe).  With over 10 years of experience in this trade, Fredinard sees an opportunity to expand his enterprise further. Nevertheless, he does not have the working capital necessary to increase his quantity of stock. Thus, his loan will be used to buy more biscuits, tins of fish, sachets of Milo, tins of tomatoes, assorted soaps, and indirectly helping him boost his overall sales. Fredinard wants to make his business self-sustainable as soon as possible. As a result, he plans to channel the new profits from his expanded business back into his provision enterprise.

loans.use: to buy more biscuits, tins of fish, sachets of Milo, tins of tomatoes, assorted soaps, and indirectly helping him boost his overall sales.

loans.name: Isha

texts.en: Isha operates a fried yam joint in Ve-Wudome (near Hohoe). Isha is a divorcee with four children. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Isha uses her income to provide for the entire family. Isha will use the loanto purchase additional yams, sweet potatoes, and gallons of oil, thus helping her improve her overall sales. As a junior high school graduate, Isha understands the importance of education in improving social conditions. Thus, she plans to use the profits from her expanded enterprise to ensure that all of her children remain in school.

loans.use: to purchase additional yams, sweet potatoes, and gallons of oil, thus helping her improve her overall sales

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a veterinary officer in Ve-Wudome (near Hohoe).  His earnings are generally used to help his wife (who is a petty trader and a farmer) support their six children. He has been involved in this veterinary service for twenty years now. He plans on using his loan to purchase additional amounts of veterinary drugs, thus helping him sell more, due to increased inventory capacity. He aspires to use his profits to both better market his services and increase his existing working capital. He hopes that this strategy will allow him to expand his present customer base.

loans.use: to purchase additional amounts of veterinary drugs, thus helping him sell more, due to increased inventory capacity

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is involved in selling soft drinks and also operates a provision shop in Ve-Wudome (near Hohoe).  Her earnings are generally used to help her husband, who is a driver, support their five children. She has been involved in selling provisions and other petty trading businesses for 20 years now. 

She plans on using her loan to purchase additional amounts of soft drinks, toilet roll, sachets of Milo (malted milk) and milk powder, biscuits, washing powder and soap, thus helping her sell more due to increased inventory capacity. 

She aspires to use her profits to both better market her soft drink and provision enterprise and to increase her existing working capital. She hopes that this strategy will allow her to expand her present customer base.

loans.use: to purchase additional amounts of soft drinks, toilet roll, sachets of Milo and milk powder, biscuits, washing powder and soap.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances, Elizabeth did not have access to any form of formal education. Yet, this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Elizabeth produces and sells palm oil in Wegbe (near Hohoe). She has been doing so for about three years and has also been involved in a petty trading business for the past twenty years now. As a divorcee with three children, Elizabeth uses all of her income to feed and provide for her family. Elizabeth will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of palm fruits and also hire labor to help pound the palm fruit, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Elizabeth wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all of her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of palm fruits as well as hire labor to help pound the palm fruit

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Eugenia is an entrepreneur. She specializes in smoking and frying fish for sale in Wegbe (near Hohoe). She has been involved in this enterprise for 17 years. Eugenia is married and has 5 children. Her husband works as a driver. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. Eugenia wants to use her loan to purchase cartons of different types of fish thereby increasing her current inventory levels. This will allow her to sell greater quantities of her fish as well as start selling it to others on wholesale. In the long term, Eugenia plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase cartons of different types of fish

loans.name: Enyonam

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Enyonam is an entrepreneur. She specializes in preparing and selling "wakye" (a traditional Ghanaian dish made primarily from beans, rice, and colored leaves). She usually sells her wakye in Wegbe (near Hohoe). She has been involved in preparing and selling wakye for four years. Enyonam is married and has one child. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. Enyonam wants to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of rice, gallons of oil, beans, and cartons of meat and chicken, thus increasing her current inventory levels. As a result, this will allow her to sell greater quantities of her tasty wakye. In the long term, Enyonam plans to reinvest the future profits back into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of rice, gallons of oil, beans, and cartons of meat and chicken thus increasing her current inventory levels

loans.name: Bernice

texts.en: Bernice is a widow with three children. After successfully graduating middle school, Bernice is now an established businesswoman. She operates a drugstore (chemical store) in Wegbe (near Hohoe). She was actively involved in this business with her husband (before he passed away) as well as another business. She has been in this business for about 32 years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Bernice uses her income to provide for the entire family. Bernice will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of medication (malaria medication since there has been increased in malaria in her community, pain killers, and cough mixtures), thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Bernice plans to diversify the type of drugs that she sells, hence adapting to changing customers preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of medication, thus helping her to improve her overall sales

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is married to a teacher. She has three children. She uses her income to help her husband pay the household expenses as well as save for a rainy day. As a middle school graduate and a fashion designer, Mercy currently sews children and women’s clothing’s in Wegbe (near Hohoe). With over 16 years of experience in this trade, Mercy sees an opportunity to expand her enterprise further. Nevertheless, she does not have the working capital necessary to increase her quantity of stock. Thus her loan will be used to buy more linen, thread, zippers and introduce the sale of clothes to her customers, indirectly helping her boost her overall sales. Mercy wants to make her business self-sustainable, as soon as possible. As a result, she plans to channel the new profits from her expanded business back into her sewing center and her provisions business.

loans.use: to buy more linen, thread, and zippers

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Even though Nancy grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Nancy is an entrepreneur. She sells smoked fish and yams in Wegbe (near Hohoe). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began 15 years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their only child and two other dependents. Nancy has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for her product. Nevertheless she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase bunches of yams and different types of smoked fish to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Nancy wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her dependents and her only child will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase bunches of yams and different types of smoked fish to sell

loans.name: Khen

texts.en:
Khen is 37 years old and has a child who is a student in a local secondary school. Khen is a widowed mother and is an employee, working for an organization in Siem Reap province. She is able to earn a decent salary, which she normally uses to provide food for her family and to send her child to school.

Khen wants to improve her living conditions by having a safe latrine for use at home since she doesn't have one, yet. She will use this loan to buy construction materials needed to build a latrine and to pay for laborers performing the construction. 

Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Khen is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to buy construction materials needed to build a latrine and to pay for laborers performing the construction.

loans.name: Ceila Pricila

texts.es: Ceila de 29 años de edad es empleada de una fábrica, vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y su esposo con lo que obtiene de su trabajo y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ela quiere hacer una mejoras a su casa construyendo unos cuartos para hacer la cocina y la sala pero con lo que gana no le alcanza para poder realizarlo, por esa razón solicita un crédito a INTEGRAL para poder comprar los materiales necesarios como: hierro, cemento, ladrillos, arena y pago de mano de obra para poder vivir junto con su familia mas seguros y comodos.
texts.en: Celia is 29 years old and works at a factory.  She lives in a home of her own with her two children and husband.  Together they are able to pay their household expenses and she wants to make some home improvements and build a kitchen and living room.  What they earn is not enough to do this, so she is asking for a loan through INTEGRAL so she can buy the necessary materials such as: iron bars, cement, bricks, sand, and pay for labor so that she and her family can live safer and more comfortably.

loans.use: to make home improvments.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: Maria vive en casa propia con su familia, ella se dedica desde hace 3 años a la agricultura siembra maíz, frijol y loroco, comercializa sus productos en las agencias de compra-venta de granos básicos, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos de su hogar, la clienta esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de herbicidas, controles de plagas, fertilizantes, etc. para obtener un mejor cultivo de locoro y asi poder obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad económica junto con su familia.
texts.en: Maria lives in a home of her own and has been farming corn, beans, and loroco for three years and sells her production to wholesalers and pays her household expenses with the proceeds.  She is asking for a loan to buy herbicides, pesticides, fertilizers, etc. so she can have a better loroco crop and be able to improve her earnings and have better financial stability for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es: Doña Maria de 62 años de edad es viuda y vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, ella posee una tienda desde hace varios años, adicional a eso también tiene una tortillería, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar y ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos, es una mujer muy honesta, trabajadora y responsable en su hogar, Doña Maria esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos para su tienda como: golosinas, refrescos, gaseosas, granos básicos, aceite, café, etc. para poder surtir con mas productos y asi obtener mejores ganancias y tener una mejor vida junto a sus hijos sin limitaciones algunas.
texts.en: Maria is 62 years old, widowed, and lives in a home of her own with her three children.  She has had a store for several years and also has a tortilla factory with which she is able to cover her household expenses and has managed to get her children ahead.  She is very honest and responsible in her home.  Maria is asking for a loan to buy more products for her store, such as snacks, soft drinks, basic grains, cooking oil, coffee, etc. so she can stock her store with more products and increase her earnings and provide a better life for herself and herself children without limitations.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es: Jose de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus cinco hijos y su esposa, desde hace varios años se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol es un hombre que siempre ha trabajado muy duro para que a su familia no le falte nada en el hogar, Jose esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plaga, herbicidas, semillas, etc. para poder seguir con sus siembras ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi poder obtener buenas ganancias para seguirle dando a su familia lo que necesitan sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Jose is 49 years old. He lives in his own home with his 5 children and his wife. For several years he has been growing corn and beans. He is a man who has always worked very hard so that his family does not lack any household needs. 

Jose is asking for a loan in order to buy fertilizer, compost, pest controls, herbicides, seeds, etc., so that he can continue working with his crops as this is his only source of work and so he can obtain good profits in order to continue providing his family with what they need without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, compost, pest controls, herbicides, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Delmy Noemy

texts.es: Delmy de 21 años de edad es madre soltera y habita junto a su padre y su pequeña hija de 3 años de edad. Delmy se dedica a la elaboración y venta de Pupusas desde hace siete años. De esta forma se gana la vida y con mucho esfuerzo va sacando a adelante a su pequeña hija. Desea invertir es su negocio de pupusas ya que desea cubrir una mayor demanda por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los insumos necesarios (maíz, queso, frijoles, repollo, tomates, etc.) para la elaboración de las deliciosas pupusas que tanto demandan sus clientes.
texts.en:
Delmy is a 21-year old single mother who lives with her father and 3-year old daughter. Delmy has made a living making and selling "pupusas" (stuffed tortillas) for 7 years. With hard work, she is able to get ahead and support her young daughter. 

She would like to invest in her "pupusas" business to cover the higher demand, which is why she is requesting this loan to FUSAI. She plans to buy the necessary ingredients (corn, cheese, beans, cabbage, tomatoes, etc.) to make the delicious "pupusas" that are so popular among her clients.

loans.use: to buy corn, cheese, beans, cabbage, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Silvia Matilde

texts.es: silvia de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus papas y su hermana, ella posee una tienda donde vende articulos de primera necesidad, granos básicos, huevos, golosinas, refrescos, etc. desde hace 4 años posee mucha clientela por la variedad de productos que comercializa, con las ganancias que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Silvia esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas productos por mayor para poder surtir aun mas su tienda y poder atender mejor a sus clientes y asi obtener mejores ganancias para tener junto con su familia una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Silvia, 33, lives in her own house with her parents and her sister. She owns a store where she sells staple goods: basic grains, eggs, snacks, soda, etc. She started four years ago. She has many customers because of the variety of products that she sells. With the profits that she obtains from her work she achieves covering some costs that come forth in her home.

Silvia is applying for a loan for the purchase of more products in bulk to be able to stock her store even more and be able to attend to her clients better. In turn, she will obtain more profit to have a better life along with her family.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, eggs, snacks, soda, etc. in bulk.

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es: José de 22 años de edad habita junto a su compañera de vida y su pequeño hijo de 3 años de edad. José es un hombre emprendedor quien hace todo lo que este a su alcance para dar a su familia el sustento diario. Él es el único que trabaja de forma remunerada ya que su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos del hogar por lo que no percibe ningún ingreso. José desea mejorar sus ingresos por lo que desea invertir en su negocio de dulces ya que es la única fuente de ingresos que posee. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de variedad de dulces para la venta y así cubrir una mayor demanda de mercado.
texts.en:
José, 22, lives along with his life partner and their small son of 3 years. José is a hardworking man who does everything in his reach to give his family daily sustenance. He is the only one who is a paid worker. Since his wife works in the domestic labor of the home, she does not earn an income. 

José wishes to improve his income, for which he desires to invest in his sweets business, since this is the only source of income he has. He is applying for this FUSAI loan to invest in the purchase of a variety of sweets for sale and, in this manner, cover a greater market demand.

loans.use: to buy a variety of sweets in bulk for selling.

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es: dora de 32 años de edad es madre soltera vive con sus tres hijos en casa propia. Ella posee una tortillería en su residencia, ya tiene muchos años con el negocio y se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues tiene un excelente servicio, es muy amable con las personas que la visitan siempre tiene una sonrisa en el rostro para ellos, además tiene gran agilidad para la elaboración de las mismas y atiende a los clientes en poco tiempo. Dora es muy dedicada en su trabajo para ella las batallas más importantes de la vida son las que peleamos diariamente para alcanzar nuestros sueños y ella está dispuesta a esforzarse por su objetivo es por eso que le solicita a ITNEGRAL  un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor para seguir produciendo. ella tiene la esperanza que de esta forma le dará a sus hijos una seguridad económica en el hogar.
texts.en:
Dora, 32, is a single mother who lives with her three children in her own house. She owns a tortilla stand in her home. She has had this business for many years already and she has made a large clientele. She has an excellent service, is very friendly with the people that visit, always has a smile on her face for them. In addition, she has great agility for making the tortillas and she takes care of the clients quickly.

Dora is very dedicated to her work. For her, the most important battles of life are those which we fight daily to reach our dreams and she is willing to push herself for her goal. For this, she is applying for a loan from ITNEGRAL which will let her buy corn in bulk to continue producing. She has the hope that in this manner she will give her children economic security in the home.

loans.use: to buy corn in bulk.

loans.name: Dinora Del Carmen

texts.es: Dinora de 51 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus hijos. Dinora se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir y cosméticos. La venta la realiza de manera ambulante en las principales zonas de su localidad y tiene mucho tiempo de dedicarse a dicho negocio por lo que cuanta con muchos clientes que cada día la prefieren más. Desea invertir en su negocio por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para hacer la compra de prendas de vestir, cremas, lociones, maquillaje, etc. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así hacer el desembolso lo antes posible con el fin de mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Dinora, 51, lives in her own house along with her husband and their children. Dinora makes her living selling clothing and cosmetics. She carries out the sales on the street in the main zones of her area. She has a lot of time to spend on said business, so every day she has more customers who prefer her more.

She wishes to invest in her business, which is why she is applying for this FUSAI loan to buy clothing, creams, perfumes, makeup, etc. She hopes she can depend on this funding and therefore make the expenditure as soon as possible with the goal of improving her income and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy: clothing, creams, perfumes, makeup, etc.

loans.name: Dimas Eladio

texts.es: Dimas de 58 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hijo, desde hace 10 años el se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado de engorde, adicional a eso también cultiva maíz y frijol, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar,Dimas esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de concentrado y vitaminas para seguir con la crianza de su ganado así poder obtener una mejor ganancia por sus ventas y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Dimas is 58 years old, and lives in his own house with his life partner and his son.  He has been raising and selling beef cattle for ten years.  In addition to this, he grows corn and beans, and with what he makes from his sales, he is able to pay some of his household expenses.
  
Dimas is seeking a loan for the purchase of feed and vitamins, in order to continue raising his cattle. This way, he will be able to obtain better earnings  from his sales, and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and feed for his cattle.

loans.name: Josue Nehemias

texts.es: Josue de 22 años de edad es soltero y habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar. Josue se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan junto con su madre. Tiene mucho tiempo de dedicarse a este negocio por lo que ya cuenta con mucha experiencia y muchos clientes que cada día la prefieren más. Desea invertir en la panadería por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los insumos necesarios (harina de pan, levadura, huevos, colorantes, mantequilla, etc.) para la elaboración del delicioso pan. Espera que de esta forma pueda mejorar sus ventas y de igual forma sus ganancias, su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Josue is a 22-year old single man who lives in his own house with his family. Josue makes a living making and selling bread with his mother. They have worked in this business for many years, so they count on extensive experience and many clients that choose them more and more each day. 

He wants to invest in the business, which is why he is requesting a loan to FUSAI. He plans to buy the necessary ingredients (flour, yeast, eggs, coloring, butter, etc.) to make their delicious bread. He expects to increase sales and income, as well as to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, eggs, coloring, butter, etc.

loans.name: Agartha

texts.en:
Agatha is a provisions seller located in Cape Coast. She has had some form of formal education, as she is a primary school leaver. 

She is married and has five children. Her husband is a trader. She has been selling provisions for quite some number of years now. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. 

She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of groceries, eggs, biscuits, Milo, milk, and sweets, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demand. 

Agatha hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to develop her business further, and ensure that all her children receive a quality education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of groceries, eggs, biscuits, Milo, milk, and sweets, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demand.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a widow and has two children. She has received some form of formal education since she is a middle school leaver. 

She sells sanitary products and materials in Cape Coast. Amina is pictured here in her shop. She has been actively involved in this business for some years. 

As the sole breadwinner of the family, she uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

Amina will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of sanitary pads, Pampers, toilet rolls, soft drinks, etc, thus aiding her in improving her overall sales. 

With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of sanitary pads, Pampers, toilet rolls, soft drinks, etc, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis de 29 años de edad habita junto a su madre e hijos  en casa alquilada. Luis se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan dulce desde hace 7 siete años  y gracias a su carisma y experiencia  ha sabido ganarse la confianza de muchos clientes que cada día lo prefieren más. Luis desea invertir en su panadería por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los insumos necesarios  (harina de pan, azúcar, colorantes, huevos, mantequilla, etc.)  para la panadería la cual es su principal fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Luis, 29, lives with his mother and children in a rented house. Luis has made and sold sweet bread for a living for 7 years and thanks to his charisma and experience he has earned the trust of many customers who like him more every day. 

Luis wants to invest in his bakery, for which he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in buying the necessary ingredients (bread flour, sugar, colourants, eggs, butter, etc.) for the bakery, which is his main source of income.

loans.use: to buy bread flour, sugar, colourants, eggs, butter, etc.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua is single and has four children. After successfully graduating primary school, Ekua is now an established businesswoman. She sells food stuffs in Cape Coast. 

As the sole breadwinner in the family, Ekua uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

Ekua will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of food stuffs, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. 

With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of food stuffs, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is single and has three children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Regina is a successful businesswoman. She runs a store selling fabric, accessories, shoes, and personal care products in Cape Coast. 

As the sole breadwinner in the family, Regina uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

Regina will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of goods, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. 

With the new profits from her expanded business, Regina plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of goods, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Eliazar

texts.es: Don Eliazar de 62 años de edad se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado desde hace varios años, ya tiene clientela establecida que lo prefieren por la calidad y los buenos precios, es hombre dedicado a su trabaja y a su familia siempre esta en busca de darles lo mejor sin limitaciones algunas, Don Eliazar esta solicitando un credito para la compra de dos vacas y poder mejorar el terreno donde las piensa tener que es el que muestra la fotografía para seguir con su trabajo ya que esa es su unica fuente de ingresos y asi poderle dar a su familia que esta conformada por su esposa y sus hijos lo que necesitan sin limitacion alguna.
texts.en:
Don Eliazar, 62, has worked raising and selling livestock for several years, he already has an established customer base that choose him for the high quality and good prices. He is dedicated to his work and his family and is always looking to give them the best, without any restrictions. 

Done Eliazar is asking for a loan to buy two cows and to be able to improve his land, which can be seen in the photograph, in order to continue with his work, which is his only source of income, and so he can give his family, which is made up of his wife and children, whatever they need without restrictions.

loans.use: to buy two cows and to be able to improve the land.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María de 53 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus hijos de 15 años y 16 años de edad. María es una mujer emprendedora quien se gana la vida por medio de la venta de tortillas y tamales lo cual le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar y colaborar con la economía del hogar. María desea construir un muro de retención ya que con las lluvias el terreno se esta lavando y no es seguro. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, arena, cemento, grava y hierro. Espera poder contar con el financiamiento y así dar inicio a la construcción del muro lo antes posible.
texts.en:
María is 53 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and two children who are 15 and 16 years old. María is an entrepreneurial woman who makes a living selling tortillas and tamales. This allows her to provide sustenance to her home and support the household finances. She hopes to build a retention wall because the heavy rains are causing the land to wash away and this is dangerous. For this reason she is requesting a loan with FUSAI to invest in the purchase of bricks, sand, cement, gravel and iron. She hopes to receive this financing so that she can start building the wall as soon as possible. 

e 53 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus hijos de 15 años y 16 años de edad. María es una mujer emprendedora quien se gana la vida por medio de la venta de tortillas y tamales lo cual le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar y colaborar con la economía del hogar. María desea construir un muro de retención ya que con las lluvias el terreno se esta lavando y no es seguro. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, arena, cemento, grava y hierro. Espera poder contar con el financiamiento y así dar inicio a la construcción del muro lo antes posible.

loans.use: to buy bricks, sand, cement, gravel, and iron to build a retention wall.

loans.name: Silvia Yaneth

texts.es: Silvia de 32 años de edad, es madre soltera vive junto a su hijo de 10 años de edad en casa de un familiar, Ella se dedica a la venta de antojitos los días sábados y domingos desde hace 8 años, es una persona trabajadora, honrada y muy responsable, su negocio tiene mucha demanda gracias a la calidad con la que elabora sus productos además por la amabilidad con la que atiende a sus clientes, gracias a su trabajo ha logrado solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Silvia solicita un crédito para comprar mesa, bancas y un toldo para el negocio, y poder ofrecerle a sus clientes un establecimiento más agradable, así mejorar su nivel de ventas, obtener mayores ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Silvia is 32 years old and is a single mother who lives with her ten year old son in a relative's home. For eight years she has made a living selling snacks on Saturdays and Sundays. Silvia is a hard working, honorable and very responsible person. Her business is in high demand thanks to the quality products that she makes and the friendliness with which she serves her customers. 

Thanks to her work, she has been able to cover some of the household expenses. Silvia is requesting a loan to buy a table, benches and an awning for her business to offer her customers a nicer establishment. This will allow her to improve her sales, obtain greater earnings and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a table, benches and an awning for her business.

loans.name: María Antonia

texts.es: Maria de 62 años de edad habita en casa propia junto con su esposo, ella se dedica a la agricultura con la ayuda de su esposo, desde hace varios años, cosecha los principales granos básicos como son: maíz y frijol, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la comercializa en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora y admirable ya que a pesar de su edad sigue trabajando y no se cansa de realizar esta actividad ya que para ella, lo más importante en la vida es ganarse el pan de cada día dignamente con el trabajo de sus manos y el sudor de su frente, Doña Maria esta solicitando un préstamo a INTEGRAL para invertir en la comprar de los insumos agrícolas como: semillas, insecticidas, abonos, fertilizantes, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para comenzar la siembra lo más antes posible. Confía plenamente que obtendrá una cosecha abundante la cual le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su esposo.
texts.en:
